contentrichtext.text: {{about|an airline of the Dominican Republic|the aircraft|Beechcraft Queen Air}} '''Queen Air''' (Aeronaves Queen SA) was an [[airline]] based at [[Las Americas International Airport]], in Santo Domingo, [[Dominican Republic]]. It began operations in 1998, but ceased these in 1999. In 2002 it was acquired by the [[Michigan]] based [[Viva Air/Auxer Group]]. An attempt to restart operations with a single [[Lockheed Tristar]] in 2004 was unsuccessful. ==Fleet== * 1 [[Airbus A320]] (reg. N302ML), leased from [[TransMeridian Airlines]]. * 1 [[Lockheed L.1011 Tristar]], from [[Kampuchea Airlines]] * 2 [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9]], from [[Capital A/C]] - ordered but not delivered. ==Code data== *[[International Air Transport Association|IATA]] Code: '''OQ *[[International Civil Aviation Organisation|ICAO]] Code: '''QNA''' *Callsign: Queen Air ==References== {{Unreferenced|date=May 2011}} <references/> {{Airlines of the Dominican Republic}} {{Aviation lists}} [[Category:Defunct airlines of the Dominican Republic]] [[Category:Airlines established in 1998]] [[Category:Airlines disestablished in 1999]] {{NorthAm-airline-stub}}
